Allergy Label Checker is an Android app that allows people with allergies to easily check food ingredient labels with their phone.

 Instrcutions:
 1. Make sure you read and accept the warning stated when starting the app. Do NOT rely only on this app for checking food labels for your allergies.
 2. In the Allergy List menu item, enter your allergy into the text field by tapping on Type allergy here.
 3. Once you entered one allergy, click the blue ADD button to the right of where you entered your allergy.
 4. Your allergy will now show up in the list below. Continue steps 2-4 until all of your allergies have shown up in the list.
 	a. To delete an allergy from the list, tap and hold on it.
 5. Click on Scan Label in the navigation window. If prompted, tap Allow to allow this app to access your device camera
 6. Point your device camera at a food ingredient label.
 	a. Detected ingredients that are not contained in your allergy list show up in green (not an allergy).
 	b. Detected allergies show up in red (detected allergies). If you see red text, you should avoid this food.
 7. To return to the menu, tap the back button on your phone.

 If you have questions or suggestions, tap the Contact button in the menu and send me an email.

 Thank you for using Ingredients Scanner!
